displaytitle: The pulpit, St. Paul's Cross: study for Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross
medium: Brown ink over graphite; red ink outlines added by Henry Ashton
creditline: Gift of George L. Small, Class of 1943
inscribed: in ink, lower center: St. Paul's  Cross erected between 1440 & 1480. | Verified to be the same seen in 1520 | red ink by Hy Ashton. G.H | this is the pulpit cross in my picture of Latimer preaching at | St Pauls Cross --copied as to general form & proportion by men | from John Gipkyns picture, in the possession of the Antiquarian Society of | London | and enriched by mouldings, as they probably were, by my | cousin Henry Ashton, Archt., for me

titles.title: Album containing 99 original drawings and 87 architecture, portrait, and costume studies of a documentary nature for the paintings Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross and The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer.

makers.displaymaker: Sir George Hayter, 1792–1871; born and died London, England

bibliography.boilertext: Ann V. Gunn, "Sir George Hayter, Victorian history painting, and a religious controversy," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 2-32.
bibliography.citation: Ann V. Gunn, "Sir George Hayter, Victorian history painting, and a religious controversy," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 2-32., p. 13, fig. 8

bibliography.boilertext: "Sir George Hayter, "Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross" and "The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer": paintings and related studies in the collection of the Art Museum," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 53, no. 1 (1994): p. 36-45.
